body:

Stephen: I can….why?

Peter: I have 2 exams, 3 essays, 1 project, and 5 homework assignments due next week. And once I’m done I’ll die and that’s where you’ll come in.

summary: I would’ve killed to have more interactions between the various spider-people. Peter B asking Miles what RIPeter was like, even...
body:
I would’ve killed to have more interactions between the various spider-people.

  • Peter B asking Miles what RIPeter was like, even if he only knew him as a hero
  • Everyone holding a memorial for RIPeter because even if they didn’t know him personally, he was one of them
  • Peter B asking Noir how Uncle Benjamin died
  • Gwen Stacey hesitantly asking Peter B or Noir if they ever knew someone like her
  • Even if she’s from the distant future, Peter B or Noir can’t help but being a little curious what Peni Parker’s father was like
  • All the spiderfam being super protective of Peni because she’s the youngest
  • Miles and Gwen understanding what it’s like for Peni to be on the younger side of the Spiderfam, but still wanting to prove yourself
  • Peni and Gwen bonding over being the only girls in tfhe spider-fam right now
  • Spider-Ham genuinely enjoys freaking out the rest of the spider-fam with his cartoon physics logic.
  • The Spider-kids introduce Spider-ham to their cartoons and it freaks him out or he’s just like “I can’t believe this reality show is here!”
  • Now they all really wanna go to his dimension and see what it’s like there
  • EVERYONE MEETING MIGUEL O’HARA BECAUSE I AM EXCITE FOR SEQUEL

Peter at his first Avengers meeting: Sorry I'm late, guys, I had homework.
Tony: Homework is not more important than being an Avenger and you sound stupid when you use it an excuse.

blog.name: parkersrhapsody
blog.title: killer queen
blog.description: i write sometimes. masterlist

summary: façade
body:
façade

summary: Peter Parker is not what you think he is.

listen to “in my head” by ariana grande

a/n : have fun with this one :)) i’m actually gonna try to use proper capitalization here lol. pete is very ooc so please do not slap me — note that pete is aged up! happy reading :D. yes i will never stop writing angst. (this is only verse 1, sorry ajsjdjjd)

painted a picture, I thought I knew you well

Peter Parker in her eyes was an angel. The sunshine in the gloomy days, the star that shines in the lone sky. The lifesaver when times were dark, the person to pick up her pieces when she broke apart. He glowed like the sun, and she swore he was an actual angel from heaven. She loved him, and gave her heart and soul to him.

I got a habit of seeing what isn’t there

But Peter Parker is not who she thinks he is. Sure, he is the friendly crime-fighting Spider-Man, but there is something deeper than that. Though she gives him everything she has, he gave nothing. Their relationship is a façade, a fake attachment built on lies.

Of course, to her oblivious self, she didn’t notice this. Blinded by love and attention, unable to see what really lies beneath those honeyed eyes.

There, under the surface of the crinkled smiles and gazing eyes, are lies. Deceiving lies that she doesn’t seem to realize because she’s fallen so deep and can’t get back up. It doesn’t hurt any of them, so why bother telling her his secrets?

caught in the moment, tangled up in your sheets

Sometimes she does get suspicious of his actions; the late-night visits out of their house, the weight of the bed lifting when she’s asleep. Instead of confronting him, she shrugs it off. Didn’t think too much of it.

Unfortunately for her, her love is unrequited. He’s not cheating, he cares too much for her to do that. Peter is simply, not in love.

when you broke my heart, I said you only wanted half of me

She wishes she hadn’t overheard the conversation between Peter and Ned. If she didn’t, she could carry on with holding the relationship on a tightrope. Sadly, curiosity killed the cat. She wished satisfaction brought her back.

“I don’t know, Ned. She’s just.. not my type. She’s pretty and kind and all, but, I don’t like her that way. I don’t love her. I wish I could tell her that.”

She peered from the corner, eavesdropping on their conversation. She was aware it was a bad idea, but the quote “curiousity killed the cat, but satisfaction brought it back,” was stamped in her head.

“You should tell her Pete. Be honest. Don’t go breaking her heart like that.” The last words Ned said before he walked away, waving goodbye and going back to his own home.

She fought back tears, choking on her breath as she composed herself. So it was all a lie.

Ever since that bright afternoon, she’d have to deal with the fact that every kiss, every hug, every embrace was forced and fake.

my imagination’s too creative — they see demon, I see angel — without a halo, wingless angel

While she was faking oblivion to his antics, Peter’s friends obviously knew the truth. Every time the couple hung out with Ned and MJ, they could see the façade of Peter. They knew, he knew, she knew. They see through their fake relationship built with unrequited love.

falling, falling, but I’d never thought you’d leave me

She’s too lost in him to remember that he’s fake. It eventually slipped her mind, but every time he didn’t say “I love you” back she’s reminded of it.

falling, falling, needed something to believe in

She wished it was real, so she believed it. It was better than admitting the truth to herself. She wanted this relationship, it’s just that Peter doesn’t.

Tonight she’s cooking dinner, spaghetti with a side salad. The plates collide with the table, setting up the food for dinner.

She takes off her apron, sits down at the table and picks at her food. The light above the dinner table feels blinding, and waiting for Peter to come home feels like forever.

Eventually the front door opens and closes. Keys are thrown to the counter, his coat shuffles off to the side. Peter slips off his shoes and walks to the dinner table.

He goes for a kiss on the forehead as a greeting, but she flinches.

Hesitantly, he sits down, glancing at the plate filled with food.

“Hey, honey, how are you?” He starts off their nightly conversation, lightly anxious by her previous actions.

She says with a monotone voice, “I’m fine.” Picking at her food, she spins a fork of noodles and plops it in her mouth. He does the same.

She gulps, blurting, “Peter, can we talk?”

He nods, while chewing some of the spaghetti she made. Peter assumes it’s something minor, but not what she was about to say.

“Did you ever love me? At all? In the three years we’ve been together?”

He basks in silence.

Peter’s answer makes the moon dim a little more. The stars shine a little less, the plants and flowers outside wither. The waves by the beach seem to crash harder. The once blinding light above the dinner table feels like it’s not even on.

Her fork drops on the plate with a clatter. She cries into the table softly, her tears seeping out one by one until it’s too much to handle. Her efforts to muffle her whimpers and cries fails.

“I knew it. I knew it, I knew it-”

She sinks into the chair, repeating the phrase like a mantra. He’s overwhelmed with gallons of guilt, looking at her image with pity.

“You could’ve just said something. Anything. Something that screamed ‘I don’t want this relationship’ instead of dealing with me.” She chokes out, sitting up, her head feeling heavy. Her head is carried by her hands.

He has tears in his eyes, but he’s not the one hurting here. It’s just out of pity. Peter glances down at the plate in shame, he can’t bring himself to look at hee heartbroken face.

I thought you were the one

“You were everything I wanted, Peter. I just wished you wanted me like that too.” She looks up at him.

“I thought we’d grow, start a family, have kids, all that clichè shit. I guess it’s just my imagination.”

He avoids her gaze, avoiding tears, biting his lip.

but it was all in my head.

“I’m sorry.” He says, looking straight at her.

“Sorry for what?”

“Everything.”

She left that night.

…

Here’s the thing; You’re in love with a version of a person that you’ve created in your head. That you are trying to but cannot fix. Uh, the only thing you can fix is yourself. I love you, this has gone on way too long. Enough is enough.

façade

painted a picture, I thought I knew you well

Peter Parker in her eyes was an angel. The sunshine in the gloomy days, the star that shines in the lone sky. The lifesaver when times were dark, the person to pick up her pieces when she broke apart. He glowed like the sun, and she swore he was an actual angel from heaven. She loved him, and gave her heart and soul to him.

I got a habit of seeing what isn’t there

But Peter Parker is not who she thinks he is. Sure, he is the friendly crime-fighting Spider-Man, but there is something deeper than that. Though she gives him everything she has, he gave nothing. Their relationship is a façade, a fake attachment built on lies.

Of course, to her oblivious self, she didn’t notice this. Blinded by love and attention, unable to see what really lies beneath those honeyed eyes.

There, under the surface of the crinkled smiles and gazing eyes, are lies. Deceiving lies that she doesn’t seem to realize because she’s fallen so deep and can’t get back up. It doesn’t hurt any of them, so why bother telling her his secrets?

caught in the moment, tangled up in your sheets

Sometimes she does get suspicious of his actions; the late-night visits out of their house, the weight of the bed lifting when she’s asleep. Instead of confronting him, she shrugs it off. Didn’t think too much of it.

Unfortunately for her, her love is unrequited. He’s not cheating, he cares too much for her to do that. Peter is simply, not in love.

when you broke my heart, I said you only wanted half of me

She wishes she hadn’t overheard the conversation between Peter and Ned. If she didn’t, she could carry on with holding the relationship on a tightrope. Sadly, curiosity killed the cat. She wished satisfaction brought her back.

“I don’t know, Ned. She’s just.. not my type. She’s pretty and kind and all, but, I don’t like her that way. I don’t love her. I wish I could tell her that.”

She peered from the corner, eavesdropping on their conversation. She was aware it was a bad idea, but the quote “curiousity killed the cat, but satisfaction brought it back,” was stamped in her head.

“You should tell her Pete. Be honest. Don’t go breaking her heart like that.” The last words Ned said before he walked away, waving goodbye and going back to his own home.

She fought back tears, choking on her breath as she composed herself. So it was all a lie.

Ever since that bright afternoon, she’d have to deal with the fact that every kiss, every hug, every embrace was forced and fake.

my imagination’s too creative — they see demon, I see angel — without a halo, wingless angel

While she was faking oblivion to his antics, Peter’s friends obviously knew the truth. Every time the couple hung out with Ned and MJ, they could see the façade of Peter. They knew, he knew, she knew. They see through their fake relationship built with unrequited love.

falling, falling, but I’d never thought you’d leave me

She’s too lost in him to remember that he’s fake. It eventually slipped her mind, but every time he didn’t say “I love you” back she’s reminded of it.

falling, falling, needed something to believe in

She wished it was real, so she believed it. It was better than admitting the truth to herself. She wanted this relationship, it’s just that Peter doesn’t.

Tonight she’s cooking dinner, spaghetti with a side salad. The plates collide with the table, setting up the food for dinner.

She takes off her apron, sits down at the table and picks at her food. The light above the dinner table feels blinding, and waiting for Peter to come home feels like forever.

Eventually the front door opens and closes. Keys are thrown to the counter, his coat shuffles off to the side. Peter slips off his shoes and walks to the dinner table.

He goes for a kiss on the forehead as a greeting, but she flinches.

Hesitantly, he sits down, glancing at the plate filled with food.

“Hey, honey, how are you?” He starts off their nightly conversation, lightly anxious by her previous actions.

She says with a monotone voice, “I’m fine.” Picking at her food, she spins a fork of noodles and plops it in her mouth. He does the same.

She gulps, blurting, “Peter, can we talk?”

He nods, while chewing some of the spaghetti she made. Peter assumes it’s something minor, but not what she was about to say.

“Did you ever love me? At all? In the three years we’ve been together?”

He basks in silence.

Peter’s answer makes the moon dim a little more. The stars shine a little less, the plants and flowers outside wither. The waves by the beach seem to crash harder. The once blinding light above the dinner table feels like it’s not even on.

Her fork drops on the plate with a clatter. She cries into the table softly, her tears seeping out one by one until it’s too much to handle. Her efforts to muffle her whimpers and cries fails.

“I knew it. I knew it, I knew it-”

She sinks into the chair, repeating the phrase like a mantra. He’s overwhelmed with gallons of guilt, looking at her image with pity.

“You could’ve just said something. Anything. Something that screamed ‘I don’t want this relationship’ instead of dealing with me.” She chokes out, sitting up, her head feeling heavy. Her head is carried by her hands.

He has tears in his eyes, but he’s not the one hurting here. It’s just out of pity. Peter glances down at the plate in shame, he can’t bring himself to look at hee heartbroken face.

I thought you were the one

“You were everything I wanted, Peter. I just wished you wanted me like that too.” She looks up at him.

“I thought we’d grow, start a family, have kids, all that clichè shit. I guess it’s just my imagination.”

He avoids her gaze, avoiding tears, biting his lip.

but it was all in my head.

“I’m sorry.” He says, looking straight at her.

“Sorry for what?”

“Everything.”

She left that night.

…

Here’s the thing; You’re in love with a version of a person that you’ve created in your head. That you are trying to but cannot fix. Uh, the only thing you can fix is yourself. I love you, this has gone on way too long. Enough is enough.

summary: A Guy that I kinda be into Spideypool ft. Johnny
body:
A Guy that I kinda be into Spideypool ft. Johnny

Imagine:

Peter and Wade are doing the usual, hanging out in the rooftops eating tacos, talking and Spider-man just starts singing.

Peter: From a guy that I’d never be into, into a guy that I’d kinda be into. Is he worth it? Wade? Is he?

Wade in his mind: Is he talking about me?

White: Of course he is. We’ve been activating your pheromones.

Yellow: Keep it up!

Peter: Say there’s this person that you never knew that well.

White and Yellow: He is totally into you

Then fast forward >>

Peter: I know that it’s weird but it’s totally true. The guy I’d kinda be into

Wade: The guy that you’d kinda be into

Peter: Yeah that

Peter & Wade: Guy that I’d kinda be into

Peter: Is…Johnny

Wade: SONOFABITCH

White & Yellow: holy shit we were wrong lmao.

The following days…

Wade unsheathing his katanas: GET BACK HERE YOU MOTHER FUCKING FIRE MONKEY

Johnny, screaming in terror: WTF WADE?!?!

summary: There isn't nearly enough fanfiction of Peter and Bucky meeting in the soul realm and I find this appauling
question: There isn't nearly enough fanfiction of Peter and Bucky meeting in the soul realm and I find this appauling
answer:
I made it serious cuz ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

Bucky’s eyes were suddenly blanketed in a shade of orange as he opened them. The world around him was empty was quiet as he sat up stiffly. His memory was foggy, the last thing he did recall was the look of fear on Steve’s face. Steve. He immediately got to his feet and started calling his friend name. His voice echoed, bouncing off the dead air around him. No answer.

He didn’t know where he was, and what was happening. It made his heart pound.

“Shit.” He sighed, rubbing his hands along his face. He needed to get out of there. Thanos was still alive and escaped. They needed to get him back.

Bucky did another 180 degrees and then began to walk in a random direction. The world he woke up in was confusing to the solider. It was the only color orange, no plants or trees or earth of any kind anywhere.

After, what seemed like forever, he saw a figure in the pigmented distance. He stopped walking suddenly, trying to make out who the figure was. The snap would have dusted literally half of the universe so the figure could be anyone. He had his gun on hand, making sure he could use it if things get bad. He slowly approached the figure, that once he got closer started to move. He held tight to the nozzle of the firearm, his heart suddenly starting to pound once again.

Once he was close enough to get a good look at the person, he dropped his gun to his waist. It was the spider-kid from Germany. The one that Tony brought along with him. He remembered the kid catching his fist with almost zero effort. The boy was strong and quick and honestly surprised Barnes. But the kid looked different though.

He had bloodshot eyes from crying and fresh tears running down his face. He looked scared.

“Kid?” Bucky called, hesitantly.

Peter shot his head up, facing the soldier and nearly melted. He didn’t know where he was or how he got there and everything seemed to be ripping at the seams. He left Tony alone on Titan and desperately wanted to get back to him. Guilt and shame ping-ponged in his brain, kicking him for staying on that spaceship in the first place. He knew Tony would blame himself for Peter’s demise and it only angered and pained the child more. But when he heard Bucky, the only person he relatively knew in this orange hell, he nearly jumped on him in relief.

the one-armed man was taken aback at first, going stiff from the embrace. Peter’s reaction was unpredictable to Bucky and he was a little confused on why he did it. Obviously.

When Peter pulled away he wiped his eyes with the back of his hand and sniffed. “I’m sorry.” He said, his voice wet with more tears. “I was just glad to finally find someone I knew.”

Bucky smiled softly at the boy as a reassured and clapped a hand on his shoulder. “It’s alright.” He answered, calmly, letting the kid collect himself before asking questions.

“Who were you with before you were dusted?” He asked, trying to not over excited the boy too much. Peter sniffed again and looked around one more time before answering, “I was with Doctor Strange and Mr. Stark.” He said, looking up at Barnes. Bucky had no idea who this Strange guy was but was glad the boy was with someone that he and Bucky knew.

“Do you know if anyone else went with you?” He asked, after a delay. Peter thought for a moment his memory also a little spotty. “Strange, Starlord, and some of his team member.” He responded, his voice growing shaky again. “I don’t remember their names.”

Bucky could see the tears well up in Parker’s eyes once again and instinctively put an arm around the boy, disregarding the fact that he barely knew him.

“Pull it together, kid,” he ordered calmly. “I need you to be strong right now, so we can get out of here.”

Peter wiped his eyes again and nodded, his gaze growing dense.

The snap would have dusted literally half of the universe so the figure could be anyone. He had his gun on hand, making sure he could use it if things get bad. He slowly approached the figure, that once he got closer started to move. He held tight to the nozzle of the firearm, his heart suddenly starting to pound once again.

Once he was close enough to get a good look at the person, he dropped his gun to his waist. It was the spider-kid from Germany. The one that Tony brought along with him. He remembered the kid catching his fist with almost zero effort. The boy was strong and quick and honestly surprised Barnes. But the kid looked different though.

He had bloodshot eyes from crying and fresh tears running down his face. He looked scared.

“Kid?” Bucky called, hesitantly.

Peter shot his head up, facing the soldier and nearly melted. He didn’t know where he was or how he got there and everything seemed to be ripping at the seams. He left Tony alone on Titan and desperately wanted to get back to him. Guilt and shame ping-ponged in his brain, kicking him for staying on that spaceship in the first place. He knew Tony would blame himself for Peter’s demise and it only angered and pained the child more. But when he heard Bucky, the only person he relatively knew in this orange hell, he nearly jumped on him in relief.

the one-armed man was taken aback at first, going stiff from the embrace. Peter’s reaction was unpredictable to Bucky and he was a little confused on why he did it. Obviously.

When Peter pulled away he wiped his eyes with the back of his hand and sniffed. “I’m sorry.” He said, his voice wet with more tears. “I was just glad to finally find someone I knew.”

Bucky smiled softly at the boy as a reassured and clapped a hand on his shoulder. “It’s alright.” He answered, calmly, letting the kid collect himself before asking questions.

“Who were you with before you were dusted?” He asked, trying to not over excited the boy too much. Peter sniffed again and looked around one more time before answering, “I was with Doctor Strange and Mr. Stark.” He said, looking up at Barnes. Bucky had no idea who this Strange guy was but was glad the boy was with someone that he and Bucky knew.

“Do you know if anyone else went with you?” He asked, after a delay. Peter thought for a moment his memory also a little spotty. “Strange, Starlord, and some of his team member.” He responded, his voice growing shaky again. “I don’t remember their names.”

Bucky could see the tears well up in Parker’s eyes once again and instinctively put an arm around the boy, disregarding the fact that he barely knew him.

“Pull it together, kid,” he ordered calmly. “I need you to be strong right now, so we can get out of here.”

Peter wiped his eyes again and nodded, his gaze growing dense.

summary: Studying...well sort of. P.P.
body:
Studying…well sort of. P.P.

that moment when you’re boyfriend peter seduces you bc you’re stressed from studying and not just because he was horny.

warnings: some smut, a princess beide reference(is that a warning? lmao).

i hope you like it! @hollandsosterfield @spiderboytotherescue @spxderbarnes @fanboy-tom

You groaned in your hands as your head pulsated. Spanish was your worst subject. Peter was by your side trying to help but honestly he just made it worse because you envied his fluency in the language.


“Maybe we should take a break.” your boyfriend suggested.

“No.” you sighed. “I can’t take a break. I need to pass. I’m barely making it as it is.”

Your eyes threatened to water but crying was the last thing you wanted to do. This test counted for nearly half your grade and you had a solid C. You needed at least a B to pass.

Peter moved closer to you and wrapped his arm around you, pressing his lips to your temple. “Babe, just take a break. Just relax.”

“I cant…Peter…” You buried your face in his chest, feeling his soft sweater.”l

He hugged you tightly, kissing your neck. “I know you can’t process information when you have a pounding headache, babe. Just relax.” he spoke in your ear, his voice sending a shiver down your spine, turning you on a bit.

“But Peter….”

“No buts. Boyfriend’s orders.” He kissed your neck again, lifting up your sleeve, trailing his kisses along your shoulder. You could already feel yourself relaxing. “Peter…” you scolded. “I’m not in the mood.”

You felt his hand crawl up your back under your shirt. “You don’t have to lift a finger, babe. I just want you to relax.” His voice eased your muscles alone.

You knew it wasn’t going to end any other way. Peter knew all the tricks to get you in the mood and it was working. You hated it but at the same time you didn’t stop him. The headache was killing you and only thing was going to make it go away.


“Peter…” you whispered.

He hoisted you onto his lap as he sat on the chair.

“Just relax babe, just like that.” He kissed your collar bone.

Your eyes fluttered, enjoying his soft lips against your skin. Your arms lifted as he pulled off your shirt. “What do you want, babe?” he murmured into your chest.

“I just want your lips all over me.” you whispered.

You felt him smile. You went into a trance as Peter pulled down your bra straps, kissing every inch of your skin. “Peter…” you moaned.

“Just relax.”

He kissed each of your breasts then moved up to neck and chin. He hesitated just as his lips hovered above yours.

“Feeling better?”

“Yes.” Your fingers entangled with his curls.

“What do you want now?” His hands framed your face.

“A massage.”

“As you wish.”

You smiled, giggling. “You’re such a dork, Peter.”

“I had to. It was unavoidable.”

“Just shut up and kiss me, Pete.”

You two kissed like it was the last time. Heat radiated between the both of you. Peter got up, holding you in his arms only to lay you on your bed. You kissed repeatedly before turning over, wanting your massage. Peter knew what to do. He pulled out your favorite lotion from your nightstand and squirted some on his hands before slowly massaging your back muscles as he sat on top of you. Sex was great and all but a massage was even better. You almost forgotten the pain you felt earlier.


You moaned his name and you knew, just knew he wore a big grin on his face even though you couldn’t see it.

“This was your plan all along wasn’t Pete?”

“What do you mean?” he asked, trying his best to sound innocent.

“Don’t give me that crap, Peter. I knew your mind was in the gutter this whole time.”

“I only wanted to destress you, babe.”

You turned back over, giving him a scolding look. “Oh, so getting laid wasn’t your intent at all?”

“Y/N, I’m shocked you even thought I had naughty intentions.”

You laughed. “I see right through you, Peter. I know when you want some.”

Peter smirked. “Okay, Y/N, maybe it came across my mind.”

“Just get down here and finish the job.”

Peter grinned as he leaned closer to you. “Yes, ma’am.”

Well so much studying…
